Description: Body sherd of East Greek, possibly Aeolian, grey ware pottery vessel, probably a krater; interior: reserved; exterior: grey slip; decoration in relief consisting of a tendril; dull to dark grey fabric with mica and limestone inclusions.
Curator's comments: Sherd may belong to a vessel similar to British Museum 1888,0601.644.a, or perhaps from the opposite side of that piece. The decoration on both sherds is the same, and so the tendril decoration on British Museum 1924,1201.71 is an extension from a horizontal handle. The fabric and decorative techniques find parallels with British Museum 1888,0601.644.c. This sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn). The origin of the fabric (NAUK 47) was not identified and considered a chemical singleton.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.074)
